review:
Overwatch fu il mio hero shooter  preferito, l'ho di gran lunga preferito a Team Fortress 2 laddove su questo avrò speso 100 ore scarse mentre su OW nel suo primo anno di vita avrò facilmente raggiunto le 1200 ore.
Peccato che la prima versione di Overwatch nonostante tutto il suo potenziale, tra lore nascosta e mostrata con i video update, comics ecc.ecc. come gioco sia stato  sacrificato da Blizzard stessa a favore della Overwatch league, quindi hanno ascoltato 4 gatti al posto della maggioranza della  community e dalla mancanza negli anni di più contenuti interessanti infatti  a fine vita la prima versione del gioco aveva sempre gli stessi identici eventi creati 6 anni prima, io personalmente iniziai a detestare e abbandonare il gioco dopo 2-3 anni  dalla sua uscita con rientri brevi ogni  tot ma con pause lunghe mesi o addirittura, prima del rilascio di Overwatch 2, di anni.
Overwatch 2 fu ed è una mega patch del primo capitolo, hanno tentato di dare una nuova vita a un gioco morto-morente e bene o male ci sono riusciti, almeno in parte, e dico in parte perchè il gioco è passato dall'essere un loot box gestito anche benino a un F2P con un sistema battle pass orribile a livello di farming soprattutto se il mese successivo non volete spendere soldi reali per continuare a usarlo .
Alla seconda versione del gioco ci avrò dedicato giusto il tempo per fare il primo e secondo battle pass e devo dire che nei primi momenti il gioco reggeva grazie al fattore novità ma dopo un tot si sentivano alcune lacune  e una Blizzard capace di fare gli stessi identici errori commessi con il primo capitolo .
Ora su steam l'ho avviato giusto per curiosata ma a occhio mi è sembrato di vedere lo stesso gioco di un anno fa, pochissimi cambiamenti l'unica cosa positiva è che il gioco ha almeno adesso riacquisto un po' di playerbase anche se sicuramente calerà nel giro di poco.
Potrei consigliare il gioco soprattutto visto quanto ci ho giocato io e come me molti altri, ma sta seconda versione non è la stessa cosa della prima e Blizzard si vede poco interessata a tenerla in vita ,basta vedere  la cancellazione della modalità PVE, il consiglio più grande è di non spendere manco un centesimo per il battle pass e giocare il gioco ogni tanto
Türkçe Dil'i eklemeyi unutmuşlar Steam'e eklerken OISDHFDASHADSFĞOGUASDFOĞUVBODASFBOIUDAFSĞUBVODFASOĞUODFAHIODFASUGOVBDAFSBUODAFSVUBDFUOAUGIOVADFBUOADFSUGVBODFSABUOUBOVADFSBUOĞVDAFSASDF

Результаты Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ: ATVI) за весь 2022 год
Ключевые финансовые результаты
Выручка: 7,53 млрд долларов США (на 14% меньше, чем в 2021 финансовом году).

Чистая прибыль: 1,51 млрд долларов США (на 44% меньше, чем в 2021 финансовом году).

Маржа прибыли: 20% (по сравнению с 31% в 2021 финансовом году). Снижение маржи было вызвано снижением выручки.

Прибыль на акцию: 1,94 доллара США (по сравнению с 3,47 доллара США в 2021 финансовом году).

[h1] Близзард уже давно не делают игры - они делают деньги. [/h1]

Имею +100 часов в игре, но на других платформах. Хочу сказать, что игра когда-то была действительно отличной, но Близзы всё испортили. Компания превратилась в разводил, которые думают только о заработке. Сейчас перед ними стоит задача выжимания денег из игроков, при этом используя минимум усилий. Цифра два в названии по факту это отражает - ничего не было кардинально изменено, близзы нагнали хайпу, чтобы продвинуть новые скины и баттлпасы за нескромные суммы денег. От пве-режима решили отказаться, видимо, потому что были сильно заняты как раз этими самыми скинами (они то деньги приносят, в отличии от масштабного нового режима, на который пришлось бы потратить уйму ресурсов). 

Призываю ни в коем случае не качать это подобие игры, даже за бесплатно.
Purchase the positive review in the shop.
better than tf2

I've been playing since 2017. Going free to play back in 2022 was good news to me if it meant constant new content and awesome paid cosmetics, but it wasn't so simple.

The game itself is fun, polished and full of cool features. It is absolutely worth it to try for a few hours, even if the new player experience sucks a bit because of content locked behind progression. However, the bad stuff severely outweights everything else.

[hr][/hr]

- New players have to play for dozens of hours to unlock all heroes, or pay for a bundle which is nonsensical and ridiculous for a competitive game in which heroes can be meta and not all heroes are viable all the time.
- The cosmetics and cosmetic bundles have top-notch quality but are ridiculously expensive and all the evil marketing tactics are right there on your face. They make zero effort to hide it. For season 6 they did not offer an option to buy the individual new story missions, instead you have to pay for a bundle with more content for "good value". Now watch them revert this just to say they're listening and that they care.
- The worst battle pass in all of gaming. Half of it is useless filler content (sprays, name cards, icons, etc.) and you get zero coins back unlike most other games (COINS are the paid currency, CREDITS are the free currency and TOKENS are another paid currency used for eSport skins).

In summary, play it. It is free and it is good, and I didn't even mention the potential for custom content with the free scripting tools that it comes with. But I'm leaving a negative review because the company behind it fucking sucks balls, and you [b]MUST NOT give them ONE cent[/b]. They are as scummy, scammy and greedy as they can get. I feel bad for all the devs and brave people fighting for the future of OW2.

Shoutout to John Spector, Aaron Keller and Jared Neuss for being the face of the team and enduring the shitstorm.

It's really just not good. This is the exact same gameplay as Team Fortress 2, from 10+ years ago.

Except, all of the visuals are far less distinct than TF2. In TF2 you can very clearly distinguish between the Medic, the Pyro, the Heavy - here, there's basically "Big blob, small blob, lots of particle effects covering them". It lacks clarity.

I can't stress this enough, the gameplay is THE EXACT SAME as TF2. I shot a dude's sentry then pushed the payload.

Gameplay is fun and unique but everything else is dogshit and designed to take money from you. $20 for 1 character skin is insane and the fact that people will pay that much for blizz not to have lowered the price yet is even more insane. Even the Overwatch 1 skins that originally just took some grinding to get are now locked behind a paywall as well (This game makes the original lootbox system look like an amazing feature). Hero based game where new players don't have access to all the heros, some heros locked behind 40 tiers of the battlepass for free to play players. Features like the leveling system were taken out for OW 2 for some unknown reason, story is a fraction of what was promised (and still costs $15 just for 3 missions), the hero mastery mode that was a big thing for season 6 doesn't even come out for another month. I do enjoy the gameplay and I do come back for it occasionally because no other game feels like this, but with almost no skins / levels to grind for as someone who doesn't want to spend my money on the game, I just play a few matches and log off for another month.

Edit: thanks for the achievements kind stranger!

Overwatch 2 is the most vile mistreatment of a game I have ever seen. The original Overwatch had issues, but was a fun competitive game to pick up and play from time to time that myself and many others had nostalgia for. Overwatch 2 ruined all that. 

The freely obtainable loot box system was replaced with a store that charges $20 for a single skin, the non-gameplay relevant but rewarding leveling system was replaced by a battlepass and within this battlepass is placed new heroes that used to be given to players immediately for free. Here? Pay money for the hero or spend an absurd amount of your time grinding daily to get them for free. Now do that every single update or you'll fall behind on heroes and HAVE to spend money to have a full roster!  

Now the game itself. Overwatch's gameplay has proven to be deeply flawed at a core level, flaws that are unfixable with a sequel update and minor balancing changes. The Tank and Team number adjustments have done little to fix the game, You stomp the other team or you get stomped. That's it. Maybe in every 10 games, you'll find a match that feels evenly balanced and have a good time, but the 9 other games aren't worth it. It is a miserable experience. 

Pair all this with the fact that Blizzard canned their ambitious PVE mode, aka the entire reason they made a sequel game to begin with, and you really see what this game is. This isn't a sequel, this is taking an existing and successful game and reworking it in as many ways as possible to drain money from your playerbase. The Invasion Update being charged DLC is even further proof of this.

And worst of all? This garbage completely replaced the original Overwatch, making it impossible to go back and play the original. Fuck you Blizzard.

Steer clear from these haters and trolls,

The game may have issues but it is not a bad game,

What we have here is an exceptional overhaul of the first Overwatch that brings with it a remarkable level of refinement and excitement! This experience is like a shiny gem, meticulously crafted and polished to perfection. It's like they've taken everything great about the original Overwatch and elevated it to a whole new level of enjoyment. 

From the moment you dive into this rebalanced version, you'll notice the delightful changes that make the gameplay more engaging than ever. It's as if the game has been given a rejuvenating potion, with every hero, every map, and every mode tweaked to create a more satisfying and exhilarating adventure. It's a refreshing take on what was already a fantastic foundation.

It's like OW1, but much more aggro and with a good amount of new content.
Ya got role queue/no role queue/no limits. it's all there except 6v6.
Controversial Points:
Cosmetics are no longer tied to lootboxes, which is good and bad.
The Good!!!???? 
-No longer tied to gacha.
-The game gives out a lot of "credits(not coins!) to buy base cosmetics which is cool. 
The Bad
-Cosmetics can be pricey($20 skin bundles)
-Heroes aren't given away for free anymore, and are tied to the BP(tier 45/buy for $10/Gamepass/or $20 bundle to unlock all OW2 heroes) during premier season, otherwise you gotta unlock em with challenges which are surprisingly easy imo.
Depended on who you are these might make or break it for you. However and ima play Devil's advocate here OW2 as a whole is ironically one of the cheaper "live service" games out there which is pretty sad when you think about it I think it's around Street Fighter 6/ Apex levels some parts better some parts worse.
esp compared to Valorant(dear god).
SO yeah thats my take, I feel the internet as a whole can be tunnel vision'd in their hate for a product and sometime forget, that their prob getting boned harder.
imo the game is good, but it's up to you.
Now for the question you basement dwellers want to know:
Is to better than TF2?
Easy answer: they aren't exactly comparable imo and similarities are surface levels. It's like saying if Street Fighter or Tekken is better lmao.
Real answer:
The Better game is easily..*connection terminated*

Bought this game in 2016. Then last year they took it down, deleted it. Stole it some might say. Stripped of key features, slapped horrible monetization on it , brought it back and called it Overwatch 2. 2 as in basically change nothing but :"the reason we took down the original is because the "2" is coming in the form of a full fledged PVE campaign someday that we couldnt finish yet but just wait yall will get it". 

Then 9 months into "Overwatch "2"", they cancel that mf and root back further by bringing back the PVE, the whole reason the first game wasnt further developed properly, in form of short story missions. THE FORMAT. THAT THEY HAD IN THE PREDECESSOR. 

In their planning. They cancel production, to make a new product, to realize they cant make the product, and go back and make the old one but worse. 

THE SUCCESSOR. THE PRODUCT THAT SHOULD BE A BETTER/IMPROVED VERSION. Is turned into an anorexic version of itself that then turns obese again with the brainless, degenerative monetization.

There are so many words and all of them combined, in infinite sentences, couldnt come close to describe how BAD this game, IP and company has outdone themselves. 

F*ck the blizzard execs for ruining one of the best IP's and being too greedy and moronic to actually convert one of the biggest alley-oops of intellectual property into quality and long lasting products.
It may not be Overwatch 1, and it may not have lootboxes, but I don't have to open the Battle.net launcher and it has achievements, so those are two major steps in the right direction
